meanings.definition: The act of making known or public
meanings.sent1: The promulgations of the new rules were posted on the bulletin board.
meanings.sent2: The promulgations of the school event were sent out to all students.
meanings.sent3: The promulgations of the surprise party spread quickly around the office.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a promulgation of her happiness to the world.
meanings.sent5: The promulgations of the safety guidelines were clear and easy to follow.

meanings.sent1: The promulgations of the election results were displayed on the screen.
meanings.sent2: The promulgations of the new law were broadcasted on television.
meanings.sent3: The promulgations of the office dress code caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: His silence was a promulgation of his disapproval of the decision.
meanings.sent5: The promulgations of the company merger were met with mixed reactions.
